addressleaf.section:
To
e right honorable S
r
Robert Cecyll Knight of her Ma
ties
privie Councel.

9 Junij 1595
M
r
Bodley to my M
r
.

page.lettertext:
fol.89r
May it please yo
r
H. of yo
r
favo
r
, to make
knowen to her
Ma
tie
at I am utterly yet unable
to take any jorney. For malis mala succ edunt,
and one indisposition doth so drawe an other to it,
as I am cleane out of strength, and also out of
hope of any speedy recoverie. I will not trouble
yo
r
L. w
t
any other allegation, albeit my privat
state doth stand in suche danger,by
e deadly
sicknesse of a frind (of whose amendem
t
I despaire),
as w
t
out apparance of my ruine I can not possibly
goe from home. If yow vouchesafe heereup
o
to
acquaint her Ma
tie
w
t
my case, and to move her
for an other to be sent in my steede, w
ch
could
not be differred in my simple judgem
t
, I will
take it from yo
r
H. for a singular benefit.
And so I take my humble leave. 9 June
Yo
r
H. humble at commandem
t
. Tho. Bodley.
